original: Paṭṭhānapakaraṇa
analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa
translated: The Chapter on the Conditions

original: Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Dukatikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (3)🔽15.1. Hetuduka, Kusalattika
analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya  hetu duka kusala ttika
translated: The Chapter on the Triads

original: 15.1.1. Kusalapada
analyzed: kusalapada
translated: The Chapter on the Wholesome

original: Namo tassa Bhagavato Arahato Sammāsambuddhassa.🔽Hetuṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu nakusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nahetuṁ🔽kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nanahetu nakusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Hetuṁ kusalañca
analyzed: namaḥ tassa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa  hetum kusalam dhammam paṭicca na hetu na kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na hetu  kusalam dhammam paṭicca na na hetu na kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā hetum kusalañca
translated: Homage to that Blessed One, the Worthy One, the Rightly Self-awakened One.

original: nahetuṁ kusalañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu nakusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā …
analyzed: na hetum kusalañca dhammam paṭicca na hetu na kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a wholesome condition that is a root as the reason, a wholesome condition that is not a root arises by way of condition through a root condition. With a wholesome condition that is not a root as the reason, a wholesome condition that is not a root arises by way of condition through a root condition. With a wholesome condition that is a root and a wholesome condition that is not a root as the reason, a wholesome condition that is not a root arises by way of condition through a root condition. …

original: tīṇi (cittasamuṭṭhānameva, ārammaṇaṁ natthi.)
analyzed: tīṇi citta samuṭṭhānam eva ārammaṇam natthi
translated: three (only mind-made, no object).

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: In the root cause there are three, in the predominance there are three, … in the unobscured there are three.

original: (Sahajātavārampi …pe… nissayavārampi paṭiccavārasadisaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāram pi pe nissaya vāram pi
translated: (The section on the origination-condition is similar to the section on the condition.)

original: Hetu kusalo dhammo nahetussa nakusalassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: hetu kusalaḥ dhammaḥ na hetussa na kusalassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A wholesome condition that is a root is a condition, by way of root condition, for a wholesome condition that is not a root.

original: Hetu kusalo dhammo nahetussa nakusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.🔽Nahetu kusalo dhammo nanahetussa nakusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: hetu kusalaḥ dhammaḥ na hetussa na kusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi  na hetu kusalaḥ dhammaḥ na na hetussa na kusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A profitable cause is a condition, as object condition, for a unprofitable, for a indeterminate … for three.🔽An unprofitable cause is a condition, as object condition, for a unprofitable, for a indeterminate … for three.

original: Hetu kusalo ca nahetu kusalo ca dhammā nahetussa nakusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu kusalaḥ ca na hetu kusalaḥ ca dhammā na hetussa na kusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A profitable and an unprofitable cause is a condition, as object condition, for a unprofitable, for a indeterminate … for three. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava, anantare samanantare nava, sahajāte
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava anantare samanantare nava sahajāte
translated: In the case of cause, there is one triad, in the case of object, nine, in the case of predominance, nine, in the case of proximity, contiguity, and support, nine,

original: nissaye tīṇi, upanissaye nava, pacchājāte tīṇi, kamme ekaṁ, āhāre ekaṁ, indriye tīṇi,
analyzed: nissaye tīṇi upanissaye nava pacchājāte tīṇi kamme eka āhāre eka indriye tīṇi
translated: in the case of nutriment, one, in the case of faculty, three,

original: jhāne ekaṁ, magge tīṇi, vippayutte tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi. (Pañhāvārampi vitthāretabbaṁ.)🔽15.1.2. Akusalapada
analyzed: jhāne eka magge tīṇi vippayutte tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi pañhāvārampi vitthāretabba  akusalapada
translated: in the case of jhana, one, in the case of path, three, in the case of dissociation, three … in the case of absence, three. (The Mode of Conveying Questions is to be expanded.)🔽… Unprofitable Mode

original: Hetuṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu naakusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: hetum akusalam dhammam paṭicca na hetu na akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a cause that is unprofitable as condition, a state without cause that is unprofitable arises through a conditionality consisting in object condition.

original: Nahetuṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu naakusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: na hetum akusalam dhammam paṭicca na hetu na akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an unwholesome root cause as condition, an unwholesome root cause arises.🔽With an unwholesome root cause and an unwholesome root cause as condition, an unwholesome root cause arises. (In brief.)

original: Hetuṁ akusalañca nahetuṁ akusalañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu naakusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: hetum akusalam ca na hetum akusalañca dhammam paṭicca na hetu na akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: In the section on root cause there are three triplets and three duals. In the section on predominance there are three triplets and three duals. … In the section on non-hindrance there are three triplets and three duals.

original: (Sahajātavārampi …pe… nissayavārampi paṭiccavārasadisaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāram pi pe nissaya vāram pi
translated: (In the section on origination, etc., the method is the same as in the case of the dependent origination.)

original: Hetu akusalo dhammo nahetussa naakusalassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.🔽Hetu akusalo dhammo nahetussa naakusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.🔽Nahetu akusalo dhammo nanahetussa naakusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: hetu akusalaḥ dhammaḥ na hetussa na akusalassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ  hetu akusalaḥ dhammaḥ na hetussa na akusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi  na hetu akusalaḥ dhammaḥ na na hetussa na akusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: An unwholesome root cause is a condition, as root cause condition, for an unwholesome root cause that is not a root cause.🔽An unwholesome root cause is a condition, as object condition, for an unwholesome root cause that is not a root cause … for three.🔽An unwholesome root cause that is not a root cause is a condition, as object condition, for an unwholesome root cause that is not a root cause … for three.

original: Hetu akusalo ca nahetu akusalo ca dhammā nahetussa naakusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu akusalo ca na hetu akusalo ca dhammā na hetussa na akusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: An unwholesome root cause and an unwholesome root cause that is not a root cause are a condition, as object condition, for an unwholesome root cause that is not a root cause … for three. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā ekaṁ, anantare samanantare nava, sahajāte🔽nissaye tīṇi, upanissaye nava, pacchājāte tīṇi, kamme ekaṁ, āhāre ekaṁ, indriye tīṇi,🔽jhāne ekaṁ, magge tīṇi, vippayutte tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽15.1.3. Abyākatapada
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā eka anantare samanantare nava sahajāte  nissaye tīṇi upanissaye nava pacchājāte tīṇi kamme eka āhāre eka indriye tīṇi  jhāne eka magge tīṇi vippayutte tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  a byākata pada

analyzed: na hetum abyākatam dhammam paṭicca na na hetu na abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi nissaya vāram pi pe pañhā vāram pi
